summary: Do you think that maybe the writers consider Dany's actions as morally grey? After all, they like Tywin as a brilliant and...
question: Do you think that maybe the writers consider Dany's actions as morally grey? After all, they like Tywin as a brilliant and pragmatic leader because he's willing to get his hands dirty to win, and they had done similar things: Dany burned down the city after their surrender, Tywin sacked the city while pretending to be an ally, not to mention the similar civilian massacre of the Rains of Castamere. Maybe they think that Dany is just being pragmatic.
answer:
God no, not at all. I mean first of all they purposely wrote Varys being super super worried about her after her grumpiness at a party in a way where we were supposed to think he had a point. She’s a women with emotions…Tywin is cool as a cucumber when he orders war crimes (fuck Tywin). Secondly Tyrion’s mission since he showed up to be with her was to control those wild womanly impulses, which had literally never extended to harm to innocent non-fighters (civilians is anachronistic) before he showed up. Once he got there she’d posit about burning down cities as an easy strawman for him to knock down.

Thirdly, they could have easily made this morally grey: she goes straight for the Red Keep after the bells ring because she doesn’t want to let Cersei get out of it with surrender after all the harm inflicted on her (Missandei and Rhaegal most recently, plus her losing so many of her people while Cersei didn’t lift a finger against the dead). That would have you know…even made sense for her character. And fuck, they could have still had her burn down KL because she could have inadvertently set off the buried caches of wild fire and had a chain reaction. Maybe from Jon and Grey Worm’s vantage they can’t tell it’s accidental, so he continues fighting still, and it’s a conflict with a sense of dramatic irony to us.

But no, they had her torch innocent smallfolk including children with the very thin justification that “I don’t feel loved I feel feared” for one reason only: she needed to be irredeemable so that our men next episode get to decide what to do with her and take her out as the surprise big bad. Remember when she locked up her dragons because the smallfolk of Meereen were terrified and one had lost a daughter? Nah, now she’s just mad everyone is scared and they all deserve to die. That sounds like her.

Also note the show painted a false dichotomy: it was presented that either she lets them surrender, or she goes scorched Earth and kills thousands. Maybe that’s because Tyrion assumes the buried wildfire would have consequence (and why verbalize anything on this show), but the body count was from her burning everyone zigzagging on the way to the Keep. You know, because she’s famously indifferent to innocent causalties of war.

Final point: we didn’t even see Dany really after she made the choice. She was just a weapon from above, and we didn’t see this as a character moment for her, or anything that could contextualize her emotions to us. Had they wanted her to seem reasonable, there could have easily been some window there.

summary: TOP 5 - Les mondes fictifs que j'aimerais visiter... Et ceux que je n'aimerais pas visiter!
title: TOP 5 - Les mondes fictifs que j'aimerais visiter... Et ceux que je n'aimerais pas visiter!
body:
TOP 5 – Les mondes fictifs que j’aimerais visiter… Et ceux que je n’aimerais pas visiter!

Chers Bookeurs, Chères Bookeuses,

Je reviens aujourd’hui avec un nouveau TAG pour vous parler de mes 5 mondes fictifs que j’aimerais voir et ceux que je ne souhaiterais pas visiter. Il existe énormément d’univers différents et il m’est impossible de tous les connaître mais étant une grande fan de Fantasy je vous ai préparé une petite sélection qui, j’espère, vous divertira le temps d’une lecture.

summary: This video says it all, pretty much.  There’s absolutely no excuse, no reasoning to be given to explain away the absurd...
caption: This video says it all, pretty much.  There’s absolutely no excuse, no reasoning to be given to explain away the absurd character shift and character assassination of Daenerys on Game of Thrones.  She isn’t fucking crazy!  She’s never shown any sign of being crazy.  God, I just can’t anymore.

reblog.comment: This video says it all, pretty much.  There’s absolutely no excuse, no reasoning to be given to explain away the absurd character shift and character assassination of Daenerys on Game of Thrones.  She isn’t fucking crazy!  She’s never shown any sign of being crazy.  God, I just can’t anymore.

trail.content_raw: This video says it all, pretty much.  There’s absolutely no excuse, no reasoning to be given to explain away the absurd character shift and character assassination of Daenerys on Game of Thrones.  She isn’t fucking crazy!  She’s never shown any sign of being crazy.  God, I just can’t anymore.
trail.content: This video says it all, pretty much.  There’s absolutely no excuse, no reasoning to be given to explain away the absurd character shift and character assassination of Daenerys on Game of Thrones.  She isn’t fucking crazy!  She’s never shown any sign of being crazy.  God, I just can’t anymore.

summary: i hate ep 5 so much but the cinematography was INSANE!!! miguel sapochnik truly delivered. i was so blown away the shots...
body: i hate ep 5 so much but the cinematography was INSANE!!! miguel sapochnik truly delivered. i was so blown away the shots especially during the cleganebowl scene. amazing visuals and cgi but what a waste of everyone’s talents for such a fucking badly written episode. i feel so bad for everyone in the production crew for putting in so much effort just for the episode to flop because of how nonsensical it was

summary:
What probably happened
GRRM: *explains Arya's plot in detail, even that she leaves in the end for some reason even tho she...
body:
What probably happened

GRRM: *explains Arya’s plot in detail, even that she leaves in the end for some reason even tho she clearly loves everyone deeply including Gendry*

D&D: Arya…sex?

GRRM: I’m sorry…what?

D&D: ARYA NO EMOTION, ONLY SEX.

GRRM: Maisie I am so sorry.

Maisie: I’ll do what I can George.

summary:
Even the news said that GoT fans are signing a petition for a Game of Thrones Season 8 do-over.
I kind of jumped into the fandom...
body:
Even the news said that GoT fans are signing a petition for a Game of Thrones Season 8 do-over.

I kind of jumped into the fandom around the last few episodes of S7 and started watching S8 and to me, the second-to-last episode felt like damage control and loose ends, and I’m pretty sure that Dany Targaryen went 0-100 real quick.

Tyrion Lannister and Arya Stark are my favorite characters, though, and I hope they live. Also, poor Brienne. 💔

blog.name: delyth88
blog.title: Mostly Loki
blog.description: Del, mid 30s. Lets be honest, this blog is mostly Loki and Tom Hiddleston, with some other Marvel, Doctor Who, LOTR, Star Trek, Good Omens, and other things that take my fancy thrown in for good measure.

tags: but boy am i glad i’m alive now
tv and dilm is just getting better and better
and telling fantastical stories so realistically
summary: With Avengers Endgame and Game of Thrones - entertainment is becoming exhausting!
body:
With Avengers Endgame and Game of Thrones - entertainment is becoming exhausting!

In a good way! But still, I wish there was a gap between them. I’d like to have the time to give them both the energy they deserve. And I’m sad they’re both coming to an end.

summary: Subverting expectations
title: Subverting expectations
body: This scene is subtle foreshadowing that Jon will use this sword to slay the Mad Queen and become a hermit instead of becoming a father.

blog.name: unfuckablebogtroll
blog.title: Stuff & Nonsense
blog.description: I mostly chatter about movies, with a pinch of politics and general ramblings thrown in

summary: But how they gonna have that amazing ending shot in 8x05 where Arya’s standing in a literal halo of light and there’s a magical...
body:
But how they gonna have that amazing ending shot in 8x05 where Arya’s standing in a literal halo of light and there’s a magical white horse miraculously there for her to ride away on, then turn around next episode and have her be like “fuck it, bye forever I guess????”

It’s just, aside from a stupid shitty fatalistic ending (there’s nothing West of Westeros, she’s gonna die out there), it’s ridiculously internally inconsistent. Literally from one episode to the next. The ending shots of 8x05 were so pointed. That was probably the last scene Maisie filmed. It was SIGNIFICANT. So how do they go from that to briefly participating in a council to make Bran (don’t get me started, it could maybe make sense for Book!Bran, but definitely not Show!Bran) King, then fucking off never to be seen again?

You give her the Chosen One imagery, just to throw it away one episode later?

I just don’t get it.

It’s just, aside from a stupid shitty fatalistic ending (there’s nothing West of Westeros, she’s gonna die out there), it’s ridiculously internally inconsistent.
